dialogues.text: Phil lingers then leaves, closing the door. Marvin begins shaking all over. As he does the bed rattles rapidly agai the wall. Leo's losing it. He's no longer the same sane m In the darkness we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby steps, make a plan.

dialogues.speaker: INT. MARVIN'S BEDROOM, THE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fay sleeps soundly next to Marvin who is wide eyed, stari at the ceiling, twitching. Marvin pulls himself carefully out of bed and crawls on the floor to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin, carrying his shoes, crawls outside. He tries to p his shoes on and falls flat on his face. He then pulls hi up and hobbles away.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE WINNIPESAUKEE GENERAL STORE, MORNING
dialogues.text: This is where the Marvin family was shopping when Bob fir came to town. Marvin paces outside until the owner opens front door for business.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE GENERAL STORE, MORNING
dialogues.text: Marvin wanders through the hardware section, looking arou FRED, the owner, works behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you, doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to buy a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred walks to a case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Winchesters. Colts. What do  you plan on hunting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er. An animal. This tall. Hundred  and seventy pounds. Bermuda shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look at this baby. It'll shoot  through anything but it also leaves  a clean wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Marvin a rifle. Marvin examines it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife was in with that Bob fellow.  Sure is a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing back the  rifle) What do you have that leaves a messy  wound?

dialogues.speaker: THE CASH REGISTER AREA
dialogues.text: Fred is ringing up Marvin's purchase: two rifles and a bo of shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need you driver's license, social  security number, and you can pick  them up on Friday... (checks a calendar) the 18th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eighteenth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a two week waiting period in  this state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait two weeks! I need these  now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the rifles. Fred keeps a firm grip on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Marvin, it's the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred wins the tug-of-war. Marvin stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about explosives? Any waiting  period there?

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOB'S COTTAGE, MORNING
dialogues.text: Marvin, carrying a bag and singing to himself, walks up t the cottage. He looks around then kicks open the door.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB'S COTTAGE, MORNING
dialogues.text: The place looks completely anonymous except for Gil in a  bowl and Bob's bag of clothes. Marvin sits on the floor,  filling a pair of milk cartons with gray powder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "Bob fell in to a Burning ring of  fire. He went down down down And the  flames went higher. And it burned  burned burned, That ring of fire.  The ring of fire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin removes a wired mechanism from the bag and a timer He delicately pushes the wires into the milk cartons then carefully ties on some fuse wires. He puts the milk carto and wired mechanisms into a BACKPACK and puts it under Bo bed. He begins laying the fuse wire along the floor towar the door. Marvin passed Gil, sitting on a table. Marvin picks up th bowl and puts it under the bed next to the bomb. He then  goes back to laying the wire into the kitchenette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin lays the fuse wire across room and out the door. H closes the door and starts to set the timer when he spots note hanging on the nearby mailbox:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading aloud) "Dear Mr. and Mrs. G., If I'm not  here, I'm at the Marvins. Would you  feed Gil? Thanks. Bob. P.S. Your  denture adhesives arrived so I put  them in your mailbox. Enjoy. Bob. "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin seethes. He thinks a moment then heads back into t cottage. Momentarily he returns carrying the back pack an the long wire fuse.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE MARVIN HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: Bob, Anna and Siggy sit around watching Fay on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if you hear from him, Donna,  please call... Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and gets her purse off the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't somebody stay here in case  he comes back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll leave him a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses then stops in front of Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob, I'm not defending Leo's recent  behavior in any way, so please don't  take this personally. However  irrational the reasons, Leo is so  upset with you that I think it would  be best if you weren't around when  he comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, mom. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I say so, Siggy. (to Bob) Please don't think it's the way I  want it. It's just that Leo's not  himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Bob's fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to your mom, Siggy. All of  you get out of here, okay? I'll  straighten up before I go and when  Dr. M. comes home, everything will  be exactly the way he likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob you're such a dear. Take good  care, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fay hugs Bob. So does Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give George a chance okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna nods. Bob turns to Siggy who is upset. Bob holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me leather, ass wiping bastard  head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Siggy swats Bob's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green puking piss-ant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family and Bob exchange pregnant good-bye looks, then Fay and Siggy and Anna exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, fam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob watches as the Marvin family walks away. They wave. B waves back, sadly. He shuffles across the room. He stops the puppets on the mantle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess this is good-bye, fam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob shuffles to Marvin's chair. He stares at the book Mar has been trying to read, Freud's Understanding Dreams the casually opens it. He reads for a moment, gets interested it and sits down. He sits back in Marvin's chair, reading

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE MARVIN HOUSE, LATER
dialogues.text: Bob is asleep in Marvin's chair, Freud's Understanding Dr open on his chest. Suddenly Marvin's face pops up at the  window. He looks in, sees Bob, then ducks back down.  Momentarily, the front door to the cottage is kicked open and there stands a seething Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up and don't make a sound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M.! Everybody's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin brandishes the back pack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. You're the doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin, carrying the back pack, leads Bob outside. Bob lo relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going hiking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this is a new form of therapy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Bob, it's death therapy. It's  a guaranteed cure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death therapy. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin leads Bob into the woods beside the cottage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits on a stump. Marvin puts the back pack on Bob's  shoulders then starts tying his hands behind him. Bob sit passively, letting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pretty imaginative, Dr. M.  Will this be in your new book?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is, I'll dedicate it to you,  how's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Ow. That hurts. Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin keeps tying Bob's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this now, pain therapy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Now yell and scream and  suffer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! Ahh! Ow! That really hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin sets the timer then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say hello to Freud for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin walks out of the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M, this hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin enters, looking happy. He goes to the stereo, puts Neil Diamond's "Penny Arcade" and cranks it up loud, then goes to the window and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling to the woods) Music to die by, Bob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin does a little dance and talks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was suicide, Fay. He tried  it once, remember. Just goes to show,  you never can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob sits trying to get comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about getting gangrene,  Dr. M! I think I get the point!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He struggles some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) At least I think I get the point. (pause) Maybe I'm not supposed to sit here. (pause) Maybe I'm supposed to undo these  outer knots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins struggling to untie himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that my inner knots..., these  strong..., restricting..., inner  knots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets a hand free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will come undone too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both hands free, Bob stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin is still dancing around, looking at his watch. He  holds up five, four, three, two, one fingers then prepare for an explosion. Instead Bob opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wearing the back pack, Bob walks into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Death therapy cured me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin runs across the room away from Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! I used to be so afraid of  everything, it was like dying a  thousand deaths a day. Now, that you  showed me I have only one death to  be afraid of, I'm not afraid of  anything anymore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin runs out the back door of the house. Bob stands th watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so modest!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE MARVIN DOCK, DAY
dialogues.text: Marvin runs out to the dock and tries to start the little motor boat that sits there. Bob stops at the back door of the house, casually tosses the back pack onto a chair, th follows Marvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob walks out onto the dock. Marvin is working franticall to start the motorboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M., I'm really cured!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house explodes. Debris rains down on Bob and Marvin.  After it settles, the bust of Freud lands on the dock in  front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did somebody leave the gas on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why won't you go away! I disgraced  myself on national television! No  one will buy my book! My family's  going to hate me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M., your family loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'M FINISHED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin is about to attack Bob then stands limp, a beaten  man. What's left of the house is now burning. The Guttman have run out of their trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burn. Burn! Burn!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, SIRENS APPROACH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M. you have the crown jewels of  England all around you. You have a  wife with a generous heart. You have  great kids and an incredible sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from my sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. M, you have a fam!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin stares at Bob then takes a small can of gas from t old motorboat and pours gas on himself. The SIRENS get cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm beginning to think  you're an ingrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are miserable all over the  world and you're killing yourself?  You should be ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk that way to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was wrong about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're not so good after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin leaps on Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin attacks Bob on the dock. Fire trucks arrive. Fay a the family drive up too. As a couple of FIREMEN and the f rush to separate Marvin and Bob...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. DOCTORS' HOUSE BOAT, SUNSET
dialogues.text: The doctors and their wives sit around Phil, stunned. Off their bow is the slab that was once the Marvin house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they took him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, it was insanity. Bob drove  Marvin to complete insanity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo was taken to the Tomsky Institute  for a few days for observation. He  lost his medical license, of course.  A doctor can't try to kill one of  his patients and expect to get away  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well thank god for that. (the other doctors  stare daggers at her) I mean..., you know... I mean... (pause) Then what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo was returned to his family.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE TOMSKY CONVALESCENT HOME, DAY
dialogues.text: Leo stands, small suitcase in hand, looking sad and fragi Fay, Anna, Siggy, Lily and Bob get out of the station wag and look at him. No one says a word, then Bob goes up and puts his arms around Leo. Leo stands motionless, shell  shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob and the family rented a lakeside  cottage where they could help Leo  recuperate.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. THE LAWN OF A LAKESIDE COTTAGE, DAY
dialogues.text: Gil's bowl sits on a lawn table. In addition to Gil, the  bowl now contains several baby guppies. Marvin lies on a  deck chair, covered with a blanket, staring into nowhere. Bob is next to him, talking on a cordless phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I understand. Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up and puts the phone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leo) Tough business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob makes some notes in his organizer then gets up. He gr hold of both of Leo's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuringly) I'm going over here. I'll be right  over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo doesn't look at him. A zombie would seem more alive. goes and joins the volleyball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm with Siggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin sits staring into nowhere. The phone rings. Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost inaudible) Phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The volleyball game continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a touch louder) Phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After another ring, he reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (listlessly affectless) Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak to Bob, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still staring into  nowhere) Bob's... unavailable right now. Can...  I take a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Jameson with the Tucson school  district. Bob contacted us about  buying some toothbrushes but we're  going to have to cancel the order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing) Tucson canceling order... Any message  why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) It's not a priority right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (writing) Not priority... right now. (pause) Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... money's tight and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (pause) Though, you know there is another  way to look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... if you gave a new toothbrush  and taught dental hygiene to every  student at your school... In the  long run you'd save them thousands  of dollars. I mean look at the cost  of dental bills. I bet I could have  put my kids through college with  what I've spent on fillings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an interesting point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is, isn't it? (pause) Maybe you should try the toothbrushes.  You might do a lot for education by  saving teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. I never thought of that. (pause) I tell you what. Tell Bob we'll take  the order and see how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin hangs up the phone. He affectless expression sudde turns to one full of thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvin sits up, gaining energy, even enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Marvin family hurries over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo Marvin now makes toothbrushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob puts his arm around Leo as he gestures and talks more and more animatedly to his delighted family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The irony, of course, is that Bob  brought the family closer than they'd  ever been before. Harvey Green saw  Leo last month and said he never  looked happier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors are stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god. The poor bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you thought you had nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Bob?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others jump in: "Yeah, what about Bob? What about Bob What about Bob?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob married Lily and had triplets.  He went back to school, got a degree  in marriage-family-counseling, and  now has a big practice on Park and  75th.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BOB WILEY'S MANHATTAN OFFICE, DAY
dialogues.text: Bob sits in the shrink's chair. Sitting in three chairs i front of him are a FATHER, MOTHER, and SON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Douche bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently to the father) Try ass wipe of the universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass wipe of the universe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family look at each other. Tears well. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctors look at each other in astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You're not telling me  that Bob Wiley is Dr. Robert S. Wiley,  the psychologist?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly what I'm telling you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BIG HOUSE BOAT goes by. Phil yells to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Bob! Hello, BOB!!

dialogues.speaker: THE BIG HOUSEBOAT
dialogues.text: Bob is surrounded by Lily Marvin, three toddlers and lots friends. Smiling, Bob waves at the doctors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrote that huge best seller? What's  it called?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob's boat turns. On it's stern, in huge letters is it's  name: "Vacation Therapy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vacation Therapy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. Sold 2 million copies.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOCTORS BOAT
dialogues.text: who are dark green with envy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll never take another vacation as  long as I live!
